clinical_study.brief_title: Optimizing the Evaluation of Awareness in Disorders of Consciousness
clinical_study.official_title: Using High-resolution Electroencephalography to Optimize the Evaluation of Awareness in Patients With Disorders of Consciousness

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether personalized stimulations can improve the detection of electrophysiological signs of awareness in patients with disorders of consciousness.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants showing differences of electrophysiological activity after personalized but not standard stimulation protocols
primary_outcome.time_frame: standard stimulations: 28 days after recruiting patients
primary_outcome.description: Depending of the personalized stimulation protocol, the differences of electrophysiological activity can the presence of event-related potentials (N100, mismatch negativity, P300, etc.) or alterations of neural oscillations. The personalized stimulation protocol will be chosen according to the families' feeling of a presence.

arm_group.description: Cerebral measurements from high-density electroencephalography after the presentation of personalized stimulations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients in a vegetative state or a minimally conscious state
- agreement from families
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with akinetic mutism or locked-in syndrome
- patients in a coma
- patients with damages in the inner or middle ear
- contraindication to a high-density electroencephalography exam
